answerText: hemophilia[10] Hemophilia A, or the "royal" form of hemophilia, is caused by a mutation in this blood clotting factor, which actually circulates in a complex with von Willebrand factor.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 19 | 9 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer some questions about a disease common in European royalty, for 10 points each: [10] This disease results from the inability to clot blood. One form of it is caused by mutations in von Willebrand factor.
